intro: Pyrrocoma angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
